questions.question: What are the four pillars of Object-Oriented Programming?
questions.experience: They also asked questions related to polymorphism and database normalization.

questions.question: How does SQL JOIN work? Explain with examples.
questions.experience: Interview started with academic background, then moved to technical and subject-based questions.

questions.question: Differentiate between TCP and UDP protocols.
questions.experience: They focused mostly on networking basics, subnetting, and OSI layers.

questions.question: What is normalization? Explain 1NF, 2NF, and 3NF with examples.
questions.experience: Mostly DBMS-related questions were asked with a few teaching-related scenarios.

questions.question: Explain the concept of Encapsulation with a real-life example.
questions.experience: The panel was friendly. They asked scenario-based OOP and project experience questions.

questions.question: What are the differences between stack and queue data structures?
questions.experience: Only technical questions were asked. No general knowledge or current affairs.

questions.question: How do you handle discipline and communication in a classroom?
questions.experience: They tested both subject knowledge and classroom management skills.

questions.question: What is the difference between a process and a thread?
questions.experience: They asked basic OS and DBMS questions, then moved to teaching methodology.

questions.question: Can you explain what is inheritance in OOP?
questions.experience: Technical questions were easy. Panel expected precise and structured answers.

questions.question: Describe your approach to lesson planning and student engagement.
questions.experience: It was a mixed interview of subject matter and pedagogy techniques.
